inclusion.criterion: Symptomatic heart failure as defined by New York Heart Association (NYHA) class II, III or ambulatory IV;
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Treatment and compliance with optimal medical therapy for heart failure for at least 30 days;
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Left ventricular ejection fraction ≤ 35%, as assessed by any one of the following methods: echocardiography, contrast left ventriculography, gated blood pool scan or cardiac magnetic resonance imaging (MRI);
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Life expectancy less than 12 months due to noncardiac conditions;
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: Patient has severe mitral valve prolapse with regurgitation and is symptomatic. However, they have a history of gestational diabetes mellitus and hypertension with pregnancy, which may impact their life expectancy.
